author: Alex Michaelides
review: The Silent Patient is a gripping psychological thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat until the very end. With its unexpected twists and turns, it's a must-read for fans of the genre.

author: Tara Westover
review: Educated is a powerful memoir that explores the author's journey from growing up in a survivalist family in Idaho to eventually earning a PhD from Cambridge University. It's a testament to the power of education and resilience.

author: Delia Owens
review: Where the Crawdads Sing is a mesmerizing novel that transports you to the marshes of North Carolina. It's a compelling story of love, loss, and survival, with beautiful prose that will stay with you long after you finish reading.

author: Michelle Obama
review: Becoming is an intimate and inspiring memoir that offers a glimpse into the life of one of the most iconic women of our time. Michelle Obama's honesty and grace shine through in this compelling narrative.

author: Erin Morgenstern
review: The Night Circus is a magical and enchanting tale set in a mysterious circus that only opens at night. With its vivid imagery and lyrical prose, it's a mesmerizing read that will transport you to a world of wonder.

author: Paula Hawkins
review: The Girl on the Train is a gripping psychological thriller that will keep you guessing until the very end. With its unreliable narrator and twisty plot, it's a page-turner that you won't be able to put down.
